website_summaries.verdict: A durable, easy-to-use multi-position hand truck that has the features and construction to suit the majority of customers needs. Unless you need an extremely heavy-duty mover, this truck will save you hassles and money.
pros: Combines a lightweight build that's easy to maneuver with a sturdy steel frame that can accommodate up to 300 pounds
Compact and easy to transport when folded
cons: Although no tools are needed to fold it, caution must be taken to avoid pinching your fingers
Not the best pick for major hauling tasks

website_summaries.verdict: A top Amazon seller. A lightweight, versatile hand truck.
pros: Versatile construction transforms from a 2- to a 4-wheel hand truck
Folds up flat for easy storage and transportation
No tools are required to fold or unfold or transform it from a 2-wheel to a 4-wheel
cons: The wheels on this hand truck are smaller and and not suited for unpaved roads

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to carry my PA system and amps to practices and gigs. Works perfect for this. Based on other reviews, I did replace the smaller wheels with slightly larger rubberized wheels (Lowes $13 total) that bolted right on. See photo.
customer_reviews.author: MrGizmo

customer_reviews.title: Good quality cart, but BEWARE WHEN FOLDING UP
customer_reviews.text: WARNING! DON'T PUT YOUR HANDS NEAR THE LARGE WHEELS WHEN COLLAPSING THIS CART. The only "instructions" are small stickers on the handle that aren't very clear. This combined with the fact that the large wheels weren't folding in when I tried to collapse the cart led me to reach around from the back of the cart to the front wheel area to see if anything was stuck. The wheels are on heavy duty springs and they suddenly snapped shut on my fingers. Extremely lucky my fingers weren't broken, as that's what it felt like. This is a nice cart, but not having clear instructions is dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: nm

customer_reviews.title: The idea of this item is great, but the design is so bad and dangerous
customer_reviews.text: The idea of this item is great, but the design is so bad and dangerous. As one of the previous buyer stated about his wife hand (She hurt her finger when she was trying to close it) it happened to me as well. When you try to close the dolly to the storage position, the wheels fold so quick and it snatch your fingers. I believe this is very dangerous item and it hurts a lot, and I hope no body else will get hurt. I wish if there is same product with better design.
customer_reviews.author: Fadi

customer_reviews.title: Cart is great
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed this cart but sometimes it has the tendency to fold out wrong - (see picture) and can be difficult to fold back into the proper position. But with some work, I was able to get it to work properly.
customer_reviews.author: CALLC

customer_reviews.title: Dolly is not at 90 degree angle when upright - objects fall when carried!
customer_reviews.text: You cannot tell from the pictures or video but when the dolly is in the upright position, the angle of the base is so obtuse that it barely stands up on its own. The problem with this is that when you go to move something with the dolly in this position, it tends to shift the objects away from you and cause them to be unstable or fall. I had many boxes fall during my recent move and I stopped using the product altogether because of it. Do yourself a favor any but a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Duke

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT heavy duty.  Indoor only
customer_reviews.text: This dolly is for indoor only. I used it only once outside and the wheels got really messed up. Many reviewers have already pointed out this fact so I am just adding on top of it. Yes, you can store it in your car easily but good luck on using it for grocery shopping. The paving will kill this item pretty fast. Update: This item will not hold 300 lb. as advertised. I use it on a 244 lb. box and the metal starts bending. With that being said, anything under 180lb should be pretty safe. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: HG

customer_reviews.title: OK as a cart, not as a dolly
customer_reviews.text: As a cart it's fine, but as a dolly, I couldn't move a 50 lb. box with it. First, the blade tilts down with weight, and whatever I tried to lift feel off of the blade. So you need a second person to load it. Then you have to tilt the dolly so much, that it's almost a cart again. I believe that the plastic hinges that allow it to be converted are the problem. Any weight at all and the joints flex or stretch. I do not recommend unless you only plan to use it as a cart.
customer_reviews.author: Willie TEXAS

customer_reviews.title: Well made and folds flat
customer_reviews.text: I needed something I could fold up and put in my truck box and this works well. I use in as a dolly most of the time. I put a couple hundreds pounds on it and it handles it. I do try to be careful with it because I want it to last. Best compact folding cart I have found yet. I have used it to move several tools and my welding equipment all around the job.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Well made but design flaw makes it impossible to use .
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to getting this cart as I thought it would be perfect for daily use of delivering medical supplies for my job. Unfortunately there is a design flaw in the bottom flap that you placed the boxes on. It is slightly angled which causes the boxes to tip forward when the cart is pulled towards you. See video for demonstration. I will be returning this cart.
customer_reviews.author: Shemaine Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to any household!
customer_reviews.text: Received and used this product 1st time today to move and relocate sandbags from Hurricane Hermine. A laborious task was rendered easy! I would highly recommend with my limited usage thus far. Will update my review if I feel the need in the future. I added a couple of bungee cords on the handle to expand the possibilities of its usefulness!
customer_reviews.author: Ray Wong

customer_reviews.title: Not safe, it nearly cut my finger when i ...
customer_reviews.text: Not safe , it nearly cut my finger when i close the base part , it not just happen once , i had different incidents too with this in the past , i thought i was just getting use to using it , but i had for a few months now .
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase of 2015
customer_reviews.text: My original thought was just to have this for my car, so when I bought groceries I can use it to lug things to my apartment. Ended up using it during the move into my apartment. Moving items from the parking garage to my apartment on the 4th floor was great with this thing. Also, went to Costco and got a lot of items. What would have taken me 3-4 trips without the cart was all done on one trip. See pic. Best thing I bought in 2015.
customer_reviews.author: Dexlest

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS. I wish I had bought this my ...
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS. I wish I had bought this my freshman year of college vs my last semester. Better late than never. I bought 2 large cases of water, a 44 lb dog food bag and 24 rolls of toilet paper (all from Sam's). I'm a 5 ft small girl and that always takes me 4 trips with many rests in between (I live in an apartment on the 2nd floor). That one trip of easily hauling all that from my car to my room made this purchase worth it. Changing from hand truck to cart is not very intuitive just from looking at it, but once you figure it out it's easy.
customer_reviews.author: Redd.Chris

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Bag
customer_reviews.text: I regularly vend at conventions and bought this as space saver. Good--it does fold up (after you figure out the pictures) rather compact. Bad--lightly constructed, small dimensions for a hand cart and, most importantly, short handle. I'm a shade under 6' and I have to stoop to be able to tug the hand cart along. If you have to to this over a long distance (like, say, the length of a convention hall), your back is definitely going to protest.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: This item is very versatile and can be stored easily to not take up space
customer_reviews.text: This item is very versatile and can be stored easily to not take up space. I recommend this to anyone living in an apartment or living situation where it may be a long walk to your car. Haven't had an issue with to much weight
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Listen to the other reviews about adding Casters
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to transport photography gear from my car to my appointment locations, back to the car, and eventually back to the studio. This gadget is super handy. However, the cheap little casters can not last long on rough terrain. When I say rough terrain, I do mean reasonable use over rough surfaces like asphalt and cement walkways. Throwing a couple casters on this as replacements for the puny rear wheels is really a must. I bought these, and they worked great! Just remember they do not come in pairs, you will need to order two: Shepherd Hardware 3266 3-Inch Threaded Stem TPR Caster with Brake, 110-lb Load Capacity by Amazon.com Learn more:
customer_reviews.author: Thomas V.

customer_reviews.title: Only 15 minute of use
customer_reviews.text: This product was great for the first fifteen minutes I used it. I had to go through quite a few door thresholds while using this product. At some point the wheel bent and broke when I was using it as a cart to move boxes out of my classroom to my car. Now it is difficult to pull and maneuver when being used as a cart. I know the boxes on the cart were not over the weight limit. Super bummed because, like I said, I really liked this product for the first 15 minutes I used it.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Know what it can and cannot handle
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy little cart. It DOES not do stairs. Mind you, that could have been my fault. I had two totes on it, tried to get down one concrete step and it spilled. I agree with other reviewers that the two front wheels are really just too tiny to handle much. The back wheels are rubber and larger. I did order the recommended replacement wheels. I have not had time to install them however. I was hoping to use this more with my recent move but it just didn’t work. I spent more time keeping items on the cart than I did with actually moving items.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Daugherty

customer_reviews.title: Adequate while it lasts
customer_reviews.text: Used this to haul 3 full PC gaming rigs to a LANFEST event. The IMMEDIATE flaw I noticed were the wheels in the front were so small they seemed to get hung up and stuck on the smallest imperfection in the parking lot and sidewalk. After literally 2 trips (maybe 600ft) these front wheels show a significant amount of wear. I have my doubts they will last long. The cart itself felt pretty stout, I used the RHINA USA bungee cord assortment you can find here - worked very well. This thing is certainly worth 60 bucks I just question the front wheel design and longevity.
customer_reviews.author: MasterBlaster

customer_reviews.title: small tires and short nose plate.
customer_reviews.text: I had to move a washer that was well under the 300 lbs capacity. This was not the dolly for the job. The tires are too small, and the nose plate bent just trying to tilt it back. But in connection with a strap, I was able to get it moved. The tires make it difficult to go over thresholds and in/out doorways. They are too small for any big job. But for small jobs, I can see this being a handy tool. Fold up easy for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: This thing is the opposite of awesome
customer_reviews.text: The worst thing about this dolly is that the part that you slide under your boxes or whatever you may be moving is not 90 degrees to the upright part of the dolly. So when you try to tilt it back, things want to fall off. Then once you're rolling things along, you have to keep it tilted back uncomfortably low to keep the things leaning on the back of the dolly. The other major flaw is that the wheels are too small to work well on stairs and bumps.
customer_reviews.author: Greg H.

customer_reviews.title: Great as a cart.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of these carts I’ve purchased. I bought one for work and it we love it for carting around boxes of files. We don’t have a ton of storage space, so the folding feature is fantastic. Same for my home use cart, wonderful for moving things around. I haven’t used it on stairs so I can’t really speak to that, but I will say it’s better in cart mode. Trying to use it as a dolly hasn’t been great. Still, I love this cart and it works for me. I keep it in my car for getting stuff to and from my apartment and to and from my car and office.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: My husband was very happy with this purchase for him for Father’s Day!
customer_reviews.text: This is just to give you an overall impression of the out-of-the-box satisfaction level. Number one my husband was quite surprised that I thought of this as being an ingenious little helper even in the house. The fact that it does work as a small trolley as well as a truck dolly increases its usefulness which is always a plus at our house. it does look sturdy enough to handle most jobs, however with a very large freezer refrigerator or any of that such you would need a industrial dolly, he seems to think it would handle our regular refrigerator in the kitchen but time will tell and I will update this review after each few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs E

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: I am a carpenter and often need to haul heavier items around. This takes up little space when put away, but will easily unfold for easy maneuverability and good capacity. I have used many different options of this type of product, and so far, this has been the best of them all. I have used it mostly in the cart position, not as a hand-truck, but I am sure that I will in the future and based upon how it has performed, that will be just as impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D. Boelke

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome, especially for the price. Pay attention to the other reviews: it is not the thing to move a refrigerator, and it is a little tricky to open and close the first few times. But it is an amazing piece of equipment. It folds flat for storage or carrying in the trunk, sets up and breaks down quickly and works great for those things that are too heavy and bulky to carry comfortably. I used it to carry 4 50lb boxes (200lbs total) and I wouldn't load it more than that. But I was able to carry 200lbs in 1 trip in comfort rather than 4 trips of straining my back. Totally worth it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very study and durable - back and energy saving - fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: So far I do like this dolly/cart to help transport my customers groceries to their doors! It has helped me on several orders thus far. It opens and folds easily, you just have to be careful to watch your fingers so you don't pinch them as your folding it up! I also like that I can fit this in the truck with a full load of groceries! It was pretty expensive (however, amazon was the cheapest I found anywhere) but well worth it, as it saves my back and energy from carry bags something really far! I am pleased with shipping time too since I have amazon prime and it only took about 48 hours to arrive maybe less!
customer_reviews.author: Gloriana

customer_reviews.title: Bottom plate opens to much greater than 90 degrees.
customer_reviews.text: This was ok except the bottom plate does not stip at 90 degrees. It opens to like 110 degrees, so whatever is on it slips off. Everything I moved with it needed to be secured down, no matter how light. I saw somwone else ask this question who had the same issue. A 60 lb 15 x 15 subwhoofer needed to be strapped down. Im pondering a return.... July 22: absolute garbage down to 1 star. nothing stays on horrible design, I would fire all invloved. Unusable as a dolly. the pronounced angle has widened. i rigged it up to kinda force it straight but this was a complete and total waste of mo ey.
customer_reviews.author: Gundamman

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This really is a nifty piece of work. Converts easily and it is, for the most part, pretty heavy duty with the exception of the smaller back trucks (casters/wheels). For some reason, while the rest of the cart has a sturdy feel to it, those little casters are a little janky so I replaced them with two of these:  They are heavy duty rubber, and I put the locking casters on the cart so that I can keep it from rolling away. They're a little bigger than the OEM trucks, but it doesn't seem to affect the operation or folding or anything. Buy with confidence...you'll get some use out of this puppy.
customer_reviews.author: George Evans

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I move often and this really helped with the boxes. I never had to use on stairs but I did use it on small and medium size rocks and cobble stone since i was deployed. When i tell you i did not have any issues with the wheels like they stated before in different reviews did not have to switch them out. was able to carry my 3 lugges ove 100 lb, or when I carried multiple boxes with different weight because i had to move out my room imme. with just one move because of this i can say it is def worth the purchase. 10/10 and you can fly with it check it with your bags!
customer_reviews.author: Denise Z

customer_reviews.title: Indoors only
customer_reviews.text: I like the folding capabilities, that's about it. Quick and easy, and cart mode is Handy. Doesn't stand up straight, leans back already in two-wheel. Can't do steps unless its a light load. Can't do gravel or rough concrete. Basically only good for indoor, smooth floors, which is not very useful. My driveway is gravel and my shed is across the yard, which is what I bought it for, and it does not work for either. Overall an ok product, but very limited actual usage.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Watch out when folding
customer_reviews.text: There are many features that this cart has, but the one thing that causes a lower rating is the difficulty and downright danger when you try to fold or unfold this cart. Watch out for your fingers and yes, your hands. Folding and unfolding can be very frustrating. Be sure to read the directions each time you use this cart. My other issue is the blade which unfolds to use as a lift when in the two wheel cart mode is somewhat flimsy. I came close to returning this, but I had disposed of the shipping carton prematurely. Lesson Learned.
customer_reviews.author: K. Harris

customer_reviews.title: it is sturdy and works well
customer_reviews.text: but as many reviewers have mentioned, this thing has some serious design flaws such as when folding, the spring that closes the wheels is too powerful and often a finger or two get stuck resulting in injury. Needs to add some safety feature to prevent that.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Helped me move my freezer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this due to needing to move a delivered chest freezer into my garage. I will admit that I struggled with trying to unfold since I didn't fully understand the instructions that were present on the actual hand truck since it was mostly pictures and arrows indication how it will look when a level wall moved. I was able to move the chest freezer into the garage, move my old freezer out of the way and maneuver my delivered freezer in the perfect spot. It rolls very smoothly. I have not tried the flatbed setup but it still feels fairly sturdy to me. It got the job done and feels well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: LiveLife

customer_reviews.title: 10 ways to lose your fingers!
customer_reviews.text: This cart is sturdy and works well but that is not to say you can't lose several of your fingers even if you are very careful! I also had an issue where the unit just jammed and the wheels would not extend, finally I got round it but I had a very frustrating 20 minutes. The design could benefit from allowing it to roll when folded, (transporting it) unfortunately you have to carry it like a baby or hang onto it like a really heavy shopping cart. I have kept this only because I didn't find a better design out there but this one could use improvements.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Julie Julie

customer_reviews.title: An excellent all-in-one foldable and compact cart/dolly
customer_reviews.text: An excellent all-in-one foldable and compact cart/dolly. I replaced the front ~ 2-Inch plastic swivel casters (aka, wheels) with a 3-Inch rubber swivel casters from Home Depot (Lowes also carries them) as others here have recommended. Cost of two wheels (pre-sales tax) was $14. I highly recommend doing so as it makes ride smoother on concrete/cement and gravel. NOTE: Have the Home Depot or Lowes "Tool Rental" department replace the wheels for you as you need a special tool to replace the wheels (some sort of impact tool they said). They did it for free and took them only a couple of minutes.
customer_reviews.author: TimTom

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be great with a slight modification
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong this thing is great and is a lifesaver when you have to move boxes/items! It's portable, fairly lightweight and easy to maneuver. I love that you can use it in either of the two configurations. Watch your fingers when you fold it back up though, tends to snap together real quick! I agree with others, if you want something little more sturdy replace the smaller wheels with slightly larger rubberized ones. I honestly have not had a problem but I move in and out of elevators a lot and the smaller wheels tend to get caught and you have to kinda do the lift and pull into the elevator. Larger rubberized wheels would definitely be better.
customer_reviews.author: m27

customer_reviews.title: Not over 160lbs.
customer_reviews.text: It works great when you use it as a hand truck and have all four wheels touching the ground. Didn't work so great as a regular dolly because the bottom flap bent downwards and we weren't able to fix it completely so that it holds anything. The clip or whatever it is that holds the flap up straight for the weight must have completely given out. The description says up to 300lbs. We were only carrying 190lbs.. There's a big difference between 190lbs. and 300lbs. I wouldn't recommend using this for anything over 160lbs. just to be on the safe side.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa R.

customer_reviews.title: 2 year’s in the making
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had mine’s in green for 2 years and have to say that It’s held up fantastically, I’ve used it to help myself and other’s move in, out, for work, garage saleing, goodwill donations, groceries...you name it. Through it all I’ve never broken anything yet and have always been thankful when I deploy and use it that I’ve had it handy. I could see someone leaving one of these in there vehicle for whatever life throws at you, and would highly recommend one based of the quite frankly unexpected durability and versatility afforded by having one of these at a moments notice.
customer_reviews.author: Moki

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent device, but big and heavy.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent device. It is wellmade and sturdy. I love how it converts from a hand truck to a 4 wheel cart. It can carry significant weight. If you're moving something heavy from the curb to your house, the garage, down the block, or wherever, this is exactly what you want. It will get the job done. However, if you have to carry this folded up, for any reason, you're not going to be happy. It is big and it is heavy. Finally, I had problems opening and closing it. It always took me three or four tries, each time I used it. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: koolkeithnyc

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my use
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my use. I am disabled and it is hard for me to carry my groceries from my van to my apartment. I needed something smaller than my other hand truck which is too big and hard to lift for me. This unit is the lightweight and perfect size for me. Fits my Honda Oddessy trunk perfect and doesn't take up a lot of room easy to assemble without any tools. As far as using it on stairs, I don't use it, I live on the first floor, so I can't review on that part
customer_reviews.author: mfmayes49

customer_reviews.title: Great cart but handle a few inches to short.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a sturdy convertible cart to haul art supplies around to classes. This fit the bill almost perfectly at the right price. The only thing I do not like is the length if the handle when the cart is in a horizontal configuration. It hurt my back as it is simply too short! Hubby is fashioning a lightweight clamp on extension handle. Some reviewers cautioned about the finger pinching Hazard of the front wheels. If you do not close it properly that might happen. Just don’t put your fingers near the wheels—it isn’t necessary.
customer_reviews.author: IT'S BY DESIGN

customer_reviews.title: Needed some adjustment
customer_reviews.text: The "foot" of the hand truck (that part that folds out at a 90 degree angle) folds out a bit further than 90 degrees. It appears to do this be design- it doesn't appear to be loose. As such, I don't have as much control of the load since the handle would bend away from the load before actually lifting it. I had to modify the hand truck's foot with some rubber stoppers in order to make the foot stop at the correct position. I believe this item works best as a 4-wheeled dolly. It can function as a hand truck as well but the aforementioned design flaw needed a work-around.
customer_reviews.author: Elberik

customer_reviews.title: What a Handy Cart
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this cart/hand truck has been a lifesaver in my move. It's easy to use, folds nicely, and is versatile. My only qualms with it are the wheels have gotten pretty roughed up over about a week of consistent use, there is definitely a learning curve to figuring out how it folds, and that you have to pull not push when using this as a cart or dolly. All in all, I would buy this again in a second. It's super useful and there are areas to strap a bungee cord to it with no issue.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: This would be perfect with better wheels.
customer_reviews.text: This would be perfect with better wheels. It works very well for moving a student in/out of the dorm. I originally purchased Shepherd Hardware 9496 3-Inch Soft Rubber wheels to replace the smaller plastic wheels. The locking lever on that wheel rubbed against the cart. I ended up going with one Shepherd Hardware 3266 3-Inch wheel and one Shepherd Hardware 3265 3-Inch wheel. Those wheels are perfect replacements, with one offering the option to lock it. To close the cart without having it snap hard, lift the wheels up off the ground as you are collapsing it and it will close smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Gslade

customer_reviews.title: Work smarter, not harder!
customer_reviews.text: This convertible hand truck/dolly is small, convenient, lightweight, and easy to convert. As a single mom and business owner, I use the dolly all the time to transport equipment, bulky items, storage bins, Amazon orders, furniture, etc. from point A to point B quickly without breaking my back from carrying! Switching from hand truck to dolly is super easy. The middle piece you need to move in order to convert is brightly colored and the transformation is smooth. It clicks into place so I know it's secure. This definitely helps me work smarter and faster, even working solo!
customer_reviews.author: E. Adams

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY flimsy noseplate
customer_reviews.text: Unlike other hand trucks that have a reinforced noseplate (i.e. the thing that heavy things rest on) that you can then use as a fulcrum, this noseplate bends under the slightest weight. You may be able cart a 300 pound object around once you have it tilted back but the hand truck itself won't help you get this into position. Basically, you need to find a way to balance an incredibly heavy object on a flimsy platform (noseplate) and hope that it doesn't bend enough to then slip off. Unfortunately this happens VERY quickly as the metal isn't reinforced and is extremely soft.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: Surgery left my torso mangled and what's left of my GI tract herniated. Unable to lift stuff 10-20#, I ordered this to help with lugging big cube boxes to key sales calls. Works great , but, you have to watch out for the nasty pinch others have mentioned. Very pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amajohn.

customer_reviews.title: A Smart Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Being a single woman who is tired of lifting and dragging heavy items around or trying to find help to do it, this is the smartest purchase I've made in a long time. I looked for something that I can use as a dolly as well as wagon. I have already brought in a thousand bags of groceries, moved boxes from the basement to the 2nd floor and even helped a neighbor with her heavy boxes. It folds down flat and fits nicely in the closet, doesn't take up any space. It's lightweight and easily transportable. It has made my life much easier and is well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: put together backwards!
customer_reviews.text: I never return anything, but, I watched the video. The wheels did not open or lock no matter what I did. I showed it to our fleet mechanic( who saw the video). The handtruck was assembled backwards. There is a hump in the middle and there is no way to lock the wheels in place.
customer_reviews.author: Juan monge

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for APT or Condo Dwellers
customer_reviews.text: Very practical for daily use for moving heavier objects (ie water, groceries, boxes, etc.). This has cut my trip back my car to unload groceries or other purchases. Surprisingly holds a lot more than you would think for a small unit. It is a little heavier than I thought it would be and unfolding it is a little difficult, but hope it gets better with more use. In any event, a must have and money very well spent for me.
customer_reviews.author: CSSO

customer_reviews.title: Small But Mighty
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this cart. I love that it folds and is easy for storage and I love the two uses that I get out of it from its configurations. The only thing I would like different is to be able to replace the smaller casters but I can’t get them off (too tight and slippery- they just keep spinning), so hopefully one day. Other than that, it is perfect to keep in my barn. I also have this on the list to gift to others.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Nuth

customer_reviews.title: Change out the wheels immediately and this cart is a dream!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic LIGHT DUTY Cart. What are you people expecting for $60; industrial use? Seriously, it works as a dolly and a hand truck and folds up easily. If you are hauling anywhere near 300 lbs at once, this is not the cart for you. If you order this cart, you should purchase and replace the little plastic rear wheels with these from the get go.  I listened to another reviewer who pointed me to these wheels and they fit perfectly and work perfectly and now I'm passing that tip along.
customer_reviews.author: Bretly

customer_reviews.title: Good for carrying things across the same story
customer_reviews.text: As a trolley-style hand truck, it works great. As a regular hand dolly, I don't recommend. The bottom grate doesn't lock into place and if you try to carry it upstairs that instability can lead to losing your load all over the place. Additionally if you didn't notice the wheels are hard plastic and could potentially damage wood surfaces if dragged inappropriately. Also beware of folding pieces so that you don't pinch your fingers like I did. They are a little stiff on a brand new device.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Too small in all the wrong places
customer_reviews.text: Overall I’m disappointed with this purchase. The foot plate to load things like a standard hand-cart is entirely too small and I dislike that it’s angled as it makes it more difficult to pick things up since it’s small and flimsy. Then when it’s set into its ly-down truck mode the handle is so low that at 6’2” I have to bend over to take it anywhere which is incredibly uncomfortable. And the body is so narrow that I’m constantly worried about things slipping off. Overall I don’t think this ones worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Could not get it operate.
customer_reviews.text: I was on a loading dock with cases and cases to move. Spent 1/2 hour trying to get it to work, watched videos online. Had two guys on the dock try to get it to work, it would not. Brought it home. Family members tried and we finally gave up. I was very concerned that someone was going to get hurt. It really is a shame because it is a nice size and seems sturdy enough. But it should work without having to fight with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Donnelly

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty for a collapsable cart
customer_reviews.text: I needed something sturdy enough to deliver multiple cases of water. I went w/ this cart since it has a high weight capacity and folds. The hand truck configuration is ok but the height of the handle does not lend well to stairs. The dolly configuration is a bonus but could benefit from 360 wheels, it doesnt do well on curved paths. Folding takes a little getting used to and I'm always afraid I'm going to pinch my fingers somewhere. If you need heavy duty and aren't concerned about how long its takes to complete the job, this is a useful tool.
customer_reviews.author: Owen101

customer_reviews.title: Good if you only need it in flat terrain
customer_reviews.text: I do ceramics, and bought this to move around my supplies / pieces. Overall, good if you don't need it very often or don't have the space to put a full cart or dolly, this will do. Pros: Versatile, light weight, and compact Cons: I really wish the wheels were bigger, ikt doesn't go very well over sidewalks. You'd better strap anything in if going over rough ground. I've had boxes fall off while taking it through the sidewalks to my apartment. A good dolly will go up stairs pretty well but this one not do well. You'll basically have to lift the whole thing
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Dependable to the end... no end in sight..
customer_reviews.text: 5+ year owner here. Cleaning out the garage and saw this piece looking at me. Emotional actually. Nothing to dislike. This tool has been instrumental in many many moves for five+ years. We have roughed it up as rough can be with it. I even used for gardening, left it out, neglected and still did the job it was intended to do. Got tossed around in the back of my truck for 1000+ miles. It has moved from light boxes to washer n dryer and even a heavy azz wardrobe. You need to know how to balance the heavy ones but when you find it’s strength it’s easy peazy! Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Leticia

customer_reviews.title: My husband even approved
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a lightweight folding hand truck to haul boxes for craft shows. I think this one will do the trick. I have folded and unfolded it a few times. You definitely have to watch the spring action when folding. Keep your hands away from the wheels when they fold in. A large tote fits great on this when in cart mode and a couple will fit on it when upright. I love that it fits nicely in my car and I can handle it myself. My husband thought I might need something more heavy duty but for the price and what this one offers, he was happy.
customer_reviews.author: sdunakey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, versatile, and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help my older in laws when transporting 5 gallon water bottles and other heavy grocery items. It is very easy to transition to the different setups and closure. Only thing I wish was different is when it is being used as a dolly, the flat bottom holder was a little longer. A 5 gallon water sits on the flat bottom but is only held up to about 3/4 of the bottle. So if you have a large, long, wide box, you might have a slight problem lifting it up.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: does the job so nicely!
customer_reviews.text: we carry anything and everything around the house, outside, in the garage.....even large heavy items can be placed on it, secured and pulled/pushed. even a small short person can carry large items once is placed/secured on it for long distances. I try it with a helper to place the large/heavy items on it and to secure it, so it wouldn't fall down or slip(then all is needed a little push).. u can easily push it around ...for changing decors...furniture...getting rid of heavy stuffs...carrying anything. very sturdy and strong/durable materials.
customer_reviews.author: αΩ

customer_reviews.title: REALLY USEFUL HEAVY DUTY CONVERTIBLE DOLLY
customer_reviews.text: GOOD HEAVY CONVERTIBLE DOLLY. AS 'EVERYONE' STATES GO AHEAD AND BUY TWO BETTER WHEELS FOR THE CART MODE. AMAZON SELLS: Shepherd Hardware 3265 3-Inch Threaded Stem TPR Caster, 110-lb Load Capacity THERE ARE SEVERAL INSTRUCTIONS IN AMAZON REVIEWS THAT SHOW YOU HOW TO CHANGE OUT THE WHEELS. YOU WILL NEED A PAIR OF CLAMP PLIERS AND A GOOD WRENCH (I USED A MONKEY WRENCH) TO LOOSEN THE BOLT. REMEMBER LEFTIE LOOSIE RIGHTY TIGHTY :-). ALSO I WILL REPEAT THE WARNING TO "WATCH YOUR FINGERS" KEEP THEM AWAY FROM THE LARGE WHEELS. IT IS EASY TO GET IN A HURRY AND FORGET, THEN "WHAM" FOLLOWED BY LOTS OF CUSSING (YOU DON'T WANT YOUR KIDS TO HEAR).
customer_reviews.author: zztop3

customer_reviews.title: Great small dolly - but count on replacing the small (rear) casters
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this dolly over three years ago and have used it on five or six occasions. It is sturdy and easy to set up and collapse for storage. It is a great small dolly / hand truck for the cost. However, as many have commented, the small casters are poor quality and wear quickly. They are inexpensive, easy to find, and easy to change, but I am surprised that Cosco puts a poor quality component on an otherwise good product. I rate this item highly despite the lousy casters because it is good overall.
customer_reviews.author: Michael_C

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool for those moving on their own. Just be aware of pinch point.
customer_reviews.text: I moved thr majority of a two bed room apartment to a townhome with this. The apartment had a long walk from door to elevator and again to car so the different configurations made it a breeze. Easily saved me thousands in moving expense. Extremely useful. As others have called out, you just need to be aware there is a pinch point when you completely fold up the unit where the large wheels snap up to lock. Do not put your hand in that area when collapsing. You just need to fold down and lift up from other end or middle to avoid this. A label here would be nice and is the only reason I took off a star.
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hand truck for household use.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, just buy it. Whilst for the most part I am only going to be hauling packages and flat pack furniture on this thing, it’s christening did happen to involve carrying out my old 200lb 30” range. For sure I had to be very careful about the angle at which I pulled it to maintain the center of gravity where I needed it, but I was impressed that it still looked brand new after dragging that weight. No bowing or bending, the handcart was completely unscathed. I’m not necessarily recommending you try your luck moving a fridge on this thing, but for medium duty household work this is an absolutely stellar purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RiskyRon

customer_reviews.title: Great folding cart
customer_reviews.text: This cart is great to keep in the garage or car as a quick cart to unfold and load with boxes or even groceries. I highly recommend that you keep a few bungee cords with it to secure your loads. Easily folds by pushing the fold button and the wheels tuck in for flat transport. *Make sure your watch your fingers as this baby can pinch your fingers if you are not paying attention when it collapses.
customer_reviews.author: Opal21

customer_reviews.title: Makes work fun
customer_reviews.text: This cart is one of the best purchases I’ve ever made, it can haul anything, from storage totes to decades of emotional baggage! Now my apartment and mind are finally clear with the help of this little bugger. Easy to use as storage cart, or a folded up as a melee weapon! If you ever wanted one of those power wheels growing up but denied by your parents, this cart can hold up my weight and let me glide quietly around like a free hearted child with no cares in the world- take that Karen of the “no fun allowed” club (her cookies are stale and always burnt on the bottom)
customer_reviews.author: TheseBurgersAreTASTY

customer_reviews.title: It worked.  Did the job I purchased it for
customer_reviews.text: I bought some additional wheel for the front, but the base cart worked quite well transporting a 110 load from New York City all the way to Rockville Maryland. I took a Greyhound by the way so that means, NYC Subway, the Greyhound bus, The Redline Train in DC to Maryland and then to my stop of White Flint. It was in a dolley configuration for the entire trip. I'll put the new wheels on this weekend which I'm sure will make the cart more invaluable.
customer_reviews.author: D. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for college move in day
customer_reviews.text: Compact, sturdy. and easy to use. Was a necessity for college move in day, saved a lot of trips to the room. Took the recommendation to upgrade the smaller wheels and glad I did since we had to cross a parking lot and sidewalk many times. Only got my fingers pinched once when folding, was a good reminder for how to properly collapse the cart.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Pilotti

customer_reviews.title: No assembly required - decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: First impression - went out to assemble it, was dreading it and grabbed tools on the way out - awesome surprise to take it out of the box assembled woohoo! Only the back wheels rotate 365, but that is to be expected. If you shake the handle vigorously, it will move around. This is because of the ability to switch positions. It’s solid enough that it feels like it will last with normal casual use. It’s made of a combo of metal and heavy duty plastic. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Compact. Holds a lot of weight. Definitely got my money’s worth during my move. Saved time and energy. I do wish that the wheels locked. If they do, I didn’t figure it out. Also wish the “base” was just a little longer. I did have to take it down two stairs during every trip and it was pretty easy. Much easier to maneuver if you have the handle side in the front.
customer_reviews.author: Clara Merriman

customer_reviews.title: Life just became less complicated.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. My back was killing me, hoofing groceries back and forth on the bus. I saw this product at Target for $60. I immediately wanted it. So, instead of buying it there, I looked on Amazon, and it was delivered like two days later. I just took it on a maiden voyage, and hauled 150# of supplies back NO problem. Of course, you'll want straps to secure the load, but other than that, this is my new handheld Cadillac.
customer_reviews.author: Col Kurtz

customer_reviews.title: A good cart, with one caveat.
customer_reviews.text: The way the cart transforms is the best feature of the Cosco Cart. It appears to be well made of quality materials. Biggest flaw is the fact the the 2 wheel cart lower platform rotates open past 90°, which makes loading a heavy stack of boxes difficult without help. There is a easy modification you can do at home to fix this problem if you find it bothersome. Basically the bottom part of the "L" pivots too far, and you loose leverage to tip the cart back. Other than that, I would trust the 4 wheeled cart to carry 300lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Raton

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to have when moving
customer_reviews.text: This hand truck has been extremely helpful these past few weeks. Holds tons of stuff with the help of bungy cords. Folding and unfolding could be easier. Have to flip the tires out to unfold - tires can be pretty dirty. The fold button is temperament, so have to play with it to get it to fold. When loaded flat, it can be a little hard to direct, but pulling is easy. Regardless, would buy again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Robin E. Soler

customer_reviews.title: 95% awesome.
customer_reviews.text: This is strong & good quality for the price. I wish the big wheels were a little bigger so it would handle stairs a little better, but it’s doable... also when it’s in flat cart mode, the back wheels do the steering which is annoying. Otherwise this is a great product & I’m happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: A.T.O.

customer_reviews.title: replacement
customer_reviews.text: small wheels are not capable to carry the promised load even 50 -60 lbs are hard to pull due to small wheels is replacement possible without freight
customer_reviews.author: Harshad Mehta

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It was difficult to figure out the exact way to begin the complete set up. Watched the video a couple times to try to figure out how to spring the wheels. Worked like a charm, however, I will keep a watch on the wheels to see if they need replacement. They are solid but small, so I can see how heavy weights and lousy pathways could do them in. We are downsizing and this light weight & collapsable dolly is perfect for us. We can carry less weight than ever and have no one to do it for us. I would suggest to any how are in the same space crunch or ability range.
customer_reviews.author: Prupip

customer_reviews.title: What a wonderful cart (with a few modifications)
customer_reviews.text: This is a awesome cart. It is longer than most collapsible hand trucks with a 49" height. I changed the back two wheels to bigger ones and moved the other two wheels to the mid handle (see pic) Now when in hand truck mode, I can lay it down and wheel it around. Perfect for Igloo's largest cooler (165 qt cooler). With the light weight and small footprint it takes up, it can go anywhere with me.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Matsunaga

customer_reviews.title: Does one thing well but not the other
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like this cart because of the price and it's two separate abilities but I ultimately only use it as a cart because using it as a dolly is just a pain. Because the floor plate is not 90 degrees from the handle, you have to tip this thing suoer far over to get anything off of the center gravity so you can move it. It's borderline dangerous how far you have to tip things over. But as a cart it's great and ill use it like that often. But if you need a dolly I would look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Durable but!!
customer_reviews.text: I really feel bad returning this hand truck, I like the design, look and feel, however the design was focused on horizontal function, and if you look at photos I posted you will see what I mean, if you pick something in vertical you will not be able to tilt without holding the item unless it is too small and light, the bottom base should be larger in length, and it should be 90 degrees to the back as you can see the difference in photos with other truck made by Cosco I bought a year ago, one last thing i wish if they made the small wheels from rubber instead of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Royal Auto Sales & Service, Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use hand truck
customer_reviews.text: I am a senior citizen (female) who lives by herself. I had a previous hand truck that was not durable enough so I purchased the Cosco heavy duty hand truck. It is extremely easy to use and I had no problems folding it into different shapes. It has been a real boon when I want to move parcels or get items from storage. I even used it to move my big plants.
customer_reviews.author: Citygirl

customer_reviews.title: A Sturdy and Reliable Work Horse
customer_reviews.text: We used this hand truck/dolly daily for several weeks during a major move. It worked great and was strong enough for the job! It is not the easiest to fold - keep your fingers away from the wheels when folding it! We did not try using it on stairs, and I doubt that the wheels are large enough to do that. In general, I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: HH

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Well. I dont know were to begin. I paid for a new one and I believe they sent me a used one. The wheels were dirty like someone used it and returned it. The handtrac setting is ok. But the cart is so low . Not for a tall person at all. But is perfect for kids to play. The worse part about it.... I hate returning things. I dont have the time for that. So.... the goodwill is my solution. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to be used in the house. I put my laundry basket on it to go from the bedroom to the laundry room. Also after I wrapped Christmas presents on the dining room table, I was able to put the presents on the cart and take them to the Christmas tree in the living room. It saved a lot of trips back and forth. Then today I had to take the stuff off the top of my washer and dryer for washer repair and I used the cart to put stuff on. Very satisfied with this cart. I'm using it even more than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Jody Highsmith

customer_reviews.title: Made for short people. : /
customer_reviews.text: pretty great, though on the heavy side. heavy duty and durable. biggest CON: made only for short people??? i'm only 5'7 and i have to kind of stoop to pull this. handle doesn't have any adjustments. what a shame. keeping it though, as the rest functions well and it is very useful. NOTE: the folding mechanism was SUPER stiff initially. you press the button on the platform of the cart, in the middle, and push on the handle to collapse. it is stiff to open initially as well. my workaround was pushing on the little plastic brackets near the wheels to get it going.
customer_reviews.author: uber_neko_zero

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for portability and ease of use
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of a portable hand truck like this one, that would be easy to store in the garage, and also to transport in a car or SUV. This hand truck meets those requirements, in that it folds flat for easy storage and transport, and is very versatile in that it can be used in two configurations, horizontal and vertical. Just be careful not to catch your fingers near a hinge when folding the hand truck!
customer_reviews.author: obfuscat3d

customer_reviews.title: Great for field service!
customer_reviews.text: Works really well as both cart and Dolley. It's a little bit tricky sometimes to get it to fold up however it's not a big deal at all. It folds fairly flat and not too heavy so pretty easy to use. I run a field service truck and we use this to bring in two 27 gallon containers and a few other items loaded on it into apartments and condos in one trip which it very useful for us and timesaver.
customer_reviews.author: multifuel

customer_reviews.title: Best hand truck/dolly
customer_reviews.text: This is the best hand truck/dolly I’ve ever purchased...and it is so good that I bought a second one after about four years of owning and using the heck out of my first one. I used it almost every single day for the past four years, on all kinds of terrain...,concrete, dirt, asphalt, rocky ground, etc...and it held up to it all. I do wish that the front wheels (closest to the handle) were more heavy duty, but for the price, I can’t complain!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wasserman

customer_reviews.title: Read the manual!
customer_reviews.text: There's a lot of good things about this contraption: it helped me move out and saved my back, and the convertibility between dolly and cart is fantastic, then it folds down to a tiny little thing for long-term storage. Only downside is that it likes to pinch your fingers when folding if you don't follow the instructions. The manual warns that it will do that, but I think everyone gets careless. Once you get the hang of this thing it really works great. I'm really happy I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H. Hoskins

customer_reviews.title: Flexible and sturdy multifunction hand truck
customer_reviews.text: It takes a while to figure out how to get it open and closed in any of its configurations, and watch your fingers as it sometimes snaps shut. It will not work on stairs in the four-wheel configuration, but operates exactly like a handcart on two wheels. The handle is comfortable and the steering is easy. Immediately retired my traditional cart. I don't consider it expensive for a well built utility item.
customer_reviews.author: Frank DLT

customer_reviews.title: Serves Well
customer_reviews.text: Works very well in it's function. I did change the black wheels as many owners recommended this. Thank to the earlier reviewer with pictures, it took me less than five minutes to switch out. As far as opening it is very easy, again thanks to an attached video on how to do it safely. Just keep your hands away from the spring loaded wheel area and you will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Never thought I'd need a personal dolly, but with the 'new normal' happening around the world, I needed to be more efficient. This dolly is absolutely great. It's easy to use, stores well and can handle stairs and bumpy payment. Really good construction and I love that it comes already assembled. Just pull out of the box and use. This is really a fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: SouthSideDiva

customer_reviews.title: Good and sturdy for something that folds up to go into the trunk or under the bed
customer_reviews.text: Great little dolly for cheap that can fold to fit in your car. Only issue I have with it is when unfolding. The small wheels on the unit can flip around and block the dolly from opening all the way. Took a second for me to find this out. But it's not rly a problem once u notice. I also think the pedal that slide under objects could be a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: Timmy metal ferret man

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly useful!
customer_reviews.text: It's not made for moving large appliances like refrigerators but I had no trouble moving a larger steam dryer with it using a strap. It's probably more useful around a home than a larger appliance type dolly, especially with it having the cart function which I found was the perfect size for moving a 30 gallon storage container. The wheels are okay but not very large. If you need to move big, heavy appliances or the like on a regular basis then this isn't what you want but it's great for a typical homeowner & occasional heavier use.
customer_reviews.author: tllong2

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, compact, and strong
customer_reviews.text: This cart has been one of my better recent purchases. It’s light, compact, and easy to fold. I use it several times a week when going down to the lobby of my high-rise condo building and collecting packages I’ve received, and I toss it in the car any time I go to a club store like Costco or BJ’s, as it allows me to carry all of those huge value-size packages into the house in a single trip. It can be a little tricky at first to figure out how to unfold it and fold it back up safely, but once you get the hang of it, it’s incredibly simple.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Mortensen

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to its billing...
customer_reviews.text: I'm an author going to various conventions with a lot of books to move. I also have a fairly small car so I don't have much extra space with all the books. This handtruck turned out to be exactly what I needed; its conversion into a cart or a handtruck is very useful in different circumstances, and that conversion is really easy; once I'd figured out how to do it, it was a snap, quick and easy. It also showed no strain under quite a load of books. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Ryk E. Spoor

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: We are downsizing and this item has been invaluable. It is truly able to handle heavy-weight and bulky items. And folds up easily to keep in the car trunk or garage. No problems with the wheels. No smashed fingers... I'm not even sure how that could happen. I do have one minor complaint. When in cart mode, the handle is low. I am not tall by any means and I have to bend over to pull it. Would be perfect if the handle telescoped. Otherwise we totally love it.
customer_reviews.author: INDALU

customer_reviews.title: Hand Truck for the Win
customer_reviews.text: We really like this hand truck! If I were to make any changes I’d make the handle adjustable. If you’re tall you have to slouch a little to reach the handle. Not the end of the world, but could be better. Folding is pretty simple, especially since the parts to enable folding are labeled “fold” on the actual hand truck. It is pretty easy to steer, even with a heavy load. For the price, it can’t be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Jon + April Belt

customer_reviews.title: holds a lot of items for the range.
customer_reviews.text: This is my range dolly. Carries all my equipment for the range. Being able to use all 4 wheels gives it the advantage of not having to fight with the weight of all the equipment. Only thing I don't like is I keep forgetting when putting the thing back in the car is the wheels snap into folded place. I keep pinching my fingers. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Jay M. Hatin

customer_reviews.title: This thing save my back
customer_reviews.text: I always have this cart inside my trunk. It is pretty handy, compact and solid. The only complaint I have is the front casters are kind of flimsy. It just made of PVC plastic, but no rubber warped around it. Therefore, do expect the front casters will wear out fast and it is noisy if you're transporting stuff outdoor. But it's an easy fix though, just buy a pair of 3 inch casters with rubbers at Amazon:  After I replaced the original casters, it is very smooth now and should last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
